alert.note: Alert for Marion (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 25 at 7:32AM CDT until June 25 at 8:15AM CDT by NWS DesMoines
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 AM CDT FOR NORTHWESTERN MARION AND CENTRAL WARREN COUNTIES... At 732 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Indianola, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. This severe storm will be near... Milo and Ackworth around 740 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this severe thunderstorm include Sandyville, Pleasantville, Knoxville, Lake Red Rock, Knoxville Raceway, Knoxville Municipal Airport and Elk Rock State Park. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...<50 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare immediately for large hail and deadly cloud to ground lightning. Seek shelter inside a well-built structure. Stay away from windows.
